title: Cyber bullying : common types of bullying 2019 , by gender
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Male, and Female. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.

For Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime), Female had the highest Share of students 387.0 among the 2 groups and in I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days), Female had the lowest Share of students 46.0.

The maximum Share of students for Male that was found in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) was 4.21 times larger than the minimum Share of students observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).

On average, the Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the highest Share of students for all 2 groups Male, and Female. Whereas I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the lowest average Share of students.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 4 different Responses for 2 groups Male, and Female that are presented on the X-axis.

Out of all 2 groups, Female had the highest Share of students for Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and Female had the lowest Share of students for Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Male, and Female. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.

For Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime), Female had the highest Share of students 387.0 among the 2 groups and in I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days), Female had the lowest Share of students 46.0.

The maximum Share of students for Male that was found in Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) was 4.21 times larger than the minimum Share of students observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).

On average, the Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the highest Share of students for all 2 groups Male, and Female. Whereas I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the lowest average Share of students.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 4 different Responses on X-axis for 2 groups Male, and Female. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.

Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the maximum Share of students among all 2 groups, and it was for Female. The minimum Share of students was observed in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) for Female.

For Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime), Male had the highest Share of students among all 4 Responses and it has the lowest Share of students in Response I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days).
Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) and I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the biggest gap of 260.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for Male.
Out of all 2 groups, the highest gap between the maximum and minimum Share of students was found in case of Male.

On average, the Response I have been cyber bullied (lifetime) had the highest Share of students for all 2 groups Male, and Female. Whereas I have cyber bullied others (previous 30 days) had the lowest average Share of students.
